item.title: [Python] Visualize coronavirus infection status with Plotly [For beginners]
item.description: Next time https://qiita.com/Naoya_Study/items/851f4032fb6e2a5cd5ed With the spread of coronavirus infection, various organizations have released cool dashboards that visualize the infection status. Example 1 WHO Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Situation Example 2 Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare new coronavirus infection domestic case Example 3 Toyo Keizai ONLINE New Coronavirus Domestic Infection Status It is cool! I want to be able to make this myself. The goal is to create a dashboard like the one above using Python’s visualization-specific data frame Dash.

item.title: [Python] Summary of basic drawing method of Plotly Express, the de facto standard of Python drawing library in the Reiwa era
item.description: # at first A library called Plotly Express (official site) that allows you to easily draw interactive operations based on javascript was released a while ago. I found. Since I felt a potential of a dimension that was clearly different from the static drawing that I have used so far, I have summarized the method of drawing a basic visualization method also as a memo. For reference, I am comparing it with the pattern that I wrote a similar figure in matplotlib+seaborn.
